title: Bringing outsiders into the space fold
summary:

title: When allies can’t count on U.S. ISR, commercial space becomes strategic
summary:
The global security environment is becoming more volatile, not less. The war in Ukraine grinds on. China is increasingly assertive in the Indo-Pacific. The Middle East remains unstable. North Korea continues to test missiles and challenge regional stability. Together, these dynamics are straining the international system in ways not seen since the early Cold War. […]

title: NASA pessimistic about odds of recovering MAVEN
summary:
NASA says it is “very unlikely” the agency will be able to recover a Mars spacecraft that has been out of contact for more than a month.

Sweden to Acquire 10 Surveillance Satellites for €121 Million
summary:
The Swedish government has committed SEK 1.3 billion (approximately €121 million) to purchase ten satellites to build out a sovereign intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance (ISR) system. title: Quantum light switch built from atomically thin mirror
summary:
Berlin, Germany (SPX) Jan 09, 2026


Controlling light across scales, from microscopes and telescopes down to nanometers, is a central challenge in modern optics. Researchers at the University of Amsterdam have now demonstrated a nanoscale mirror whose reflectivity can be switched on and off electrically using quantum effects in an atomically thin material.

title: Quantum key method enables redundant storage of qubit data
summary:
Los Angeles CA (SPX) Jan 07, 2026


A team of researchers at the University of Waterloo have demonstrated a method to back up quantum information by encrypting qubits during copying, providing redundancy while remaining consistent with the no-cloning theorem. 

Quantum computing stores and processes information in qubits, which can be implemented in individual electrons, photons, atoms, ions or tiny electrical currents.
